SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package com.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs

Class TaskDialogUI

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs.TaskDialogUI
Direct Known Subclasses:
TaskAddingDialogUI, TaskEditingDialogUI
public class TaskDialogUI extends Object
Represents the UI of the dialog serves as a base for the TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI classes, allowing the user to add or edit a task.

Fields:
  • dialog - a JDialog represents the dialog shown to the user, allowing them to add or edit a task
  • dialogButtons - an array of JButton representing buttons displayed within the dialog
  • weekDaysComboBox - a JComboBox representing a combo box with weekdays, displayed within the dialog
  • tasksComboBox - a JComboBox representing a combo box with task names, displayed within the dialog
  • timeSpinner - a JSpinner representing a spinner allowing the user to choose a time, displayed within the dialog
  • prioritySpinner - a JSpinner representing a spinner allowing the user to choose a priority, displayed within the dialog
  • descriptionTextArea - a JTextArea representing a text area allowing the user to enter the description of the task, displayed within the dialog
  • planners - a HashMap containing tasks sorted by each day of the week
  • task - a reference to a SingleTaskManager representing a single task
Configuration methods:
  • configureDialog() - configures the dialog adding common components and settings for both TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI
Dialog panels creators:
  • createTaskSelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select a name for the task
  • createWeekDaySelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the weekday for the task
  • createTimeSelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the time for the task
  • createPrioritySelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the priority of the task
  • createDescriptionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to enter the description of the task
  • createButtonsPanel() - creates a JPanel containing JButtons allowing the user to save task or cancel the action
  • createPanel(Component, String) - creates a JPanel for the other panel creation methods, based on the provided parameters
Getters: getPlanners(), getDialogButtons(), getWeekDaysComboBox(), getTimeSpinner(), getPrioritySpinner(), getDescriptionTextArea(), getTasksComboBox(), getTask(), getDialog()

    • planners

      private final HashMap<String,HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager>> planners
      Contains a HashMap of tasks sorted by each day of the week. The key is a String representing the weekday name, and the value is a HashMap where the key is a String representing the time and the value is a SingleTaskManager representing the task.
      See Also:
      • TaskDialogUI(HashMap, SingleTaskManager)

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskDialogUI

      TaskDialogUI(HashMap<String,HashMap<String,SingleTaskManager>> planners, SingleTaskManager task)
      Constructs a new TaskDialogUI with the specified planners and task. This constructor initializes the dialog for adding or editing task, and also initializes task and planners fields. It initializes UI components: dialogButtons, weekDaysComboBox, timeSpinner, prioritySpinner, descriptionTextArea and tasksComboBox. Finally, it invokes configureDialog() to configure the dialog field.
      Parameters:
      planners - a HashMap containing SingleTaskManagers sorted by each day of the week
      task - a SingleTaskManager representing a single task with its details
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogUI(HashMap)
      • TaskEditingDialogUI(HashMap, SingleTaskManager)

  • Method Details

    • configureDialog

      private void configureDialog()
      Configures the dialog by setting its layout, size, modality, and adding the JPanels created in the createTaskSelectionPanel(), createWeekDaySelectionPanel(), createTimeSelectionPanel(), and createPrioritySelectionPanel() methods. These settings are common for the TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI.
      See Also:
      • TaskDialogUI(HashMap, SingleTaskManager)

    • createTaskSelectionPanel

      private JPanel createTaskSelectionPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel and the tasksComboBox. This method sets the selected item in the tasksComboBox to the current task's name, and then creates and returns a JPanel using the createPanel(Component, String) method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with a JLabel and the tasksComboBox
      See Also:
      • configureDialog()

    • createWeekDaySelectionPanel

      private JPanel createWeekDaySelectionPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel and the weekDaysComboBox. This method sets the selected item in the weekDaysComboBox to the current task's weekday, and then creates and returns a JPanel using the createPanel(Component, String) method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with a JLabel and the tasksComboBox
      See Also:
      • configureDialog()

    • createTimeSelectionPanel

      private JPanel createTimeSelectionPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel and the tasksComboBox. This method configure timeSpinner so that user can select the time in the "HH:mm" format. It also sets the selected time in the timeSpinner to the current task's time, and then creates and returns a JPanel using the createPanel(Component, String) method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with a JLabel and the tasksComboBox
      See Also:
      • configureDialog()

    • createPrioritySelectionPanel

      private JPanel createPrioritySelectionPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel and the prioritySpinner using the createPanel(Component, String) method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with a JLabel and the prioritySpinner
      See Also:
      • configureDialog()

    • createDescriptionPanel

      JPanel createDescriptionPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing a JLabel and the descriptionTextArea. This method checks content of the task's description. If description doesn't equal "unknown", the content of the task's description is appended to the descriptionTextArea. Then, it creates a JScrollPane with the descriptionTextArea as a parameter and sets the vertical scroll bar polity. Finally, it creates and returns a JPanel using the createPanel(Component, String) method.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with the JLabel and the descriptionTextArea
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogUI.configureTaskAddingDialog()
      • TaskEditingDialogUI.configureTaskEditingDialog()

    • createButtonsPanel

      JPanel createButtonsPanel()
      Creates a JPanel containing the dialogButtons.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with the dialogButtons
      See Also:
      • TaskAddingDialogUI.configureTaskAddingDialog()
      • TaskEditingDialogUI.configureTaskEditingDialog()

    • createPanel

      JPanel createPanel(Component component, String textLabel)
      Creates and returns a JPanel containing a JLabel and a Component. The JLabel contains a textLabel, and is displayed next to the corresponding Component. The label provides context for the Component, helping the user understand the expected input.
      Parameters:
      component - a Component allowing the user to input data, and the program to download data.
      textLabel - a String representing the component name, used to create a JLabel.
      Returns:
      a JPanel with a JLabel and a Component
      See Also:
      • createTaskSelectionPanel()
      • createWeekDaySelectionPanel()
      • createTimeSelectionPanel()
      • createPrioritySelectionPanel()
      • createDescriptionPanel()
      • createPanel(Component, String)
